intro: Delaportea, commonly known as the "butterfly plant," is a genus of flowering plants in the family Melastomataceae. It is native to the tropical regions of South America, particularly Brazil and Peru. The plant is characterized by its striking, showy flowers that often resemble butterflies, hence its common name. Delaportea species typically have opposite, ovate leaves and produce small, clustered fruits. These plants are often found in moist, shaded environments and are valued for their ornamental beauty in horticulture.
